document_data.name: Plaza of the Sacred Elephants
document_data.mainbody: The '''Plaza of the Sacred Elephants''' was a public square located in [[Dihliz]] in the [[Cities of the Ancients]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{cite book/Ruined Kingdoms/Campaign Guide|19}}
document_data.Description:
The Plaza sat in the northeast section of the city between the [[Ivory Palace]] and the great mosques of Dihliz.

The square was dominated by two fantastic life-size sculptures of [[elephant]]s rearing up on their hind legs and facing each other.
document_data.Activities: All sorts of individuals filled the Plaza during business hours including merchants, courtiers, and viziers, many of whom had business with the [[Hassana Alim al-Gaib|Emira]].
